title: Ralph Waldo Emerson - Essential Writings & Selected Letters
description:
RALPH WALDO EMERSON (1803-1882) was an American essayist, lecturer, and poet.

As one of the architects of the Transcendentalist movement in the mid-nineteenth century, Emerson embraced a philosophy that championed the individual, emphasized independent thought, and prized "the splendid labyrinth of oneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own perceptions."  When asked to sum up his work, he said his central doctrine was "the infinitude of the private man."  More than any writer of his time, Emerson forged a style distinct from his European predecessors and embodied and defined what it meant to be an American.  Matthew Arnold called Emerson's essays "the most important work done in prose."


* THE ESSENTIAL WRITINGS OF RALPH WALDO EMERSON (Modern Library, 2000).  Edited by Brooks Atkinson, with an Introduction by Mary Oliver. -- EPUB

* THE SELECTED LETTERS OF RALPH WALDO EMERSON (Columbia University Press, 1997).  Edited by Joel Myerson. -- PDF
